metadata.name: rflktr #264
metadata.description:
a generative artwork by Juhani Halkom√§ki

Celebrating my one year fxhash anniversary. The piece is based on my first project on fxhash, the Reflector. In this piece I continued the exploration on rays and reflection in 2D space. The end result is a colorful and fragile artwork with a hint of melancholy.

----

press 's' to save (only works after the piece has fully rendered)
press '1' to '9' to change the resolution

metadata.name: 0RAL B1NARY: ‚ÄúBINARY ODE‚Äù #156
metadata.description:
An ‚Äúalgorhythmic‚Äù exploration of the oral/aural tradition in poetry. 

‚ÄúZero is a time of night.
Zero is the color of snow.
Zero is the space between notes.
Zero is the silence between words.
Zero is the pause before breath.
Zero is void in the heart of a crowd.
Zero is not nothing, but it‚Äôs not everything.
One is a time of day.
One is the color of spring grass in sunlight.
One is the warmth at the back of my neck when I turn to find you standing there.
One is the rhythm at the base of my spine.
One is the peace at the core of my being.
One is the sound of your voice in the dark.
And one more thing:
Without one I am nothing‚Ä¶‚Äù
‚ÄìTechnelegy 
 

Fusing AI-powered verse, spoken word, original music and visuals all in generative composition, this playful ode to our universal language is inspired by Stiles‚Äô binary-based art and Stern‚Äôs performative poetics. The experiment centers on a transhuman poem by Stiles‚Äô AI alter ego, Technelegy, voiced as zeroes and ones, layered with human- and machine-generated sound ‚Äì evoking ancient data transmissions in the oral tradition as well as the immersive potential of multisensorial, multimedia, metaversal language and literature. Brought into existence via the blockchain, it is a new form of ‚Äútoken word poetry.‚Äù


As with the duo‚Äôs other poetry ‚Äúunreadings,‚Äù all minters will receive an airdropped broadside of the full poem after all editions are collected. A 1/1 media-rich version of the entire poem will also be made available. 
 
Poetic traits:
- 321 editions performed by the algorithm, out of billions of possible combinations
- Each unique piece contains between 3 and 6 (out of 60) lines of generative text from a poem by Technelegy ‚Äì a custom text generator fine-tuned on Stiles‚Äô writing and research material, seeded with prompts from Stiles‚Äô and Stern‚Äôs work ‚Äì translated into binary and performed by Stiles
- 24 possible binary backbeats performed by Stern in his ‚ÄúNathaniel Fun Time‚Äù (NFT) stylings, and generatively re-mixed
- 98 possible intros
- 15 musical stems composed by Kris Bones, generating millions of possible mixes
- Thousands of possible ending combinations 
- 5 fonts, layered in billions of potential ways, including Stern and Stiles‚Äô custom AI font, NNFT (Neural Network Font Type), developed for their ongoing collaboration, ‚ÄúMother Computer‚Äù
- 13 color palettes based on Stern and Stiles‚Äô respective artworka
- Very rare attributes including music-less performance, poem-less music, repeated ‚ÄúB1nary 0de‚Äù (title only)

Click to start and stop or replay. Although the first play through will be the same every time, starting and stopping may create minor variations in your mix (though not any of the core attributes).

0RAL B1NARY: ‚ÄúBINARY ODE‚Äù was produced with partial support from Refraction DAO‚Äôs Creative Grants program, and premiered as part of Refraction Festival at Art Basel Miami 2022. 15% of primary sales go to Refraction, and 5% of primary sales will be donated to Black Girls Code.

metadata.name: Boketto #26
metadata.description:
'Boketto' is the act of gazing vacantly into the distance without a thought.

On the process of making this collection, i explored interfering patterns in order to give an abstract and more painted look on the canvas.

--Features--

Palette : 14 different color palettes
Scheme : 11 different schemes
Step : 7 different steps
Rotation : 9 types (each type has more than 30 different outcomes)

Press "s" to save a 1600x2000 PNG

High resolution outputs will be uploaded on my (under contruction) site soon 

Made with p5js & ‚ù§Ô∏è

Gtsiliakos_art, October 2022

metadata.name: Commune #48
metadata.description:
A minimalist composition with a nod towards architecture.

2932 bytes of Vanilla JS.

For more info, see article linked below: Me, Commune, Etc.

In live mode:
‚ÄôS‚Äô : save as svg (without grain)
‚ÄòP‚Äô : save as png (3780x2673)

URL params in live mode:
‚Äòg=n‚Äô : no grain
‚Äòg=w‚Äô : wood grain
‚Äòh=t‚Äô : high resolution mode, 7560‚Ää√ó‚Ää5346 (Chrome only)

After rendering with these params, tapping 'P' will then save the png with those settings applied.

metadata.name: Layers #38
metadata.description:
It's the first time I really delved into studying about P5JS

I spent the last one collecting generative art and it made my passion for all this just grow, as a collector I wanted to move forward and want to do something more and so developed this project. 

I've been a designer for almost 10 years, an art director for over 1 year, I work all day with design every day, Photoshop and its infinite layers haunt me all day, as my passion wanted to insert something related there in my work so I thought of "layers" and thus "Layers" was born, layers and layers, specifically of rectangles one on top of the other forming the interactions of this work.

5 Styles:

Dunes:
Curves, some sharp and others less so, some remind me of sand dunes.

moiree:
It reminds me a little of compositions with a Moir√© effect, forming curves where there is the presence of shadows giving relief.

Arranged:

A style where there is a certain organization of lines, but not perfect.

Strips:

Strips of colors on top of each other.

Harmonic:
It forms flat compositions, they are more organized layers.


17 Color Palettes based on famous works such as paintings and compositions:

"Mondrian - Composition with Large Red Plane, Yellow, Black, Gray and Blue / Piet Mondrian"
"Monalisa - Leonardo da Vinci"
"Portrait - Van Gogh self-portrait / Van Gogh"
"Venus - The Birth of Venus / Sandro Botticelli"
"Memory - The Persistence of Memory / Salvador Dal√≠"
"Son - The Son of Man /Ren√© Magritte"
"Guitarist - The Old Guitarist / Pablo Picasso"
"Canna - Red Canna / Georgia O'Keeffe"
"Drowning - Drowning Girl / Roy Lichtenstein"
"American - American Gothic / Grant Wood"
"Sunrise - Impression, Sunrise / Claude Monet"
"Creation - The Creation of Adam / Michelangelo"
"Girl - Girl with a Pearl Earring / Johannes Vermeer"
"Square - Black Square / Kazimir Malevich"
"Wave - The Great Wave off Kanagawa / Katsushika Hokusai"
"Wanderer - Wanderer above the Sea of ‚Äã‚ÄãFog / David Friedrich"
"Scream - The Scream / Edvard Munch"

"Layers" uses grains/noises function by Gorilla Sun, thanks for sharing your article with us! Article https://www.fxhash.xyz/article/all-about-that-grain

Created with p5js / Alex Benedith

metadata.name: Hexagones Landscape #109
metadata.description:
An undulating (sometimes) landscape made up of hexagons (or "Hexagones" laying in wait) to celebrate the first birthday of fxhash. Written at the last minute the weekend before the birthday week.

A simpler 16 colour version of this project was originally coded on an Atari ST 512, about 32 years ago, figured it was time to update it.

INSTRUCTIONS ::

h - Toggle high-res
s - Download and save image

PRINTING INSTRUCTIONS ::

High-res will output a 6,553 x 8,192 image, at 300dpi it should print at...

21.84 x 27.3 inches
55.47 x 69.3 cm

metadata.name: Annihilate This Week #252
metadata.description:
This is a companion piece to "Saturday Night's Alright (For Fighting)" (project #14045). Same algorithm of the previous one, only slightly modified, the main difference is that here the daily variations are all mixed up together and the output doesn't change based on the current day.

This is intended to be a gift for all collectors and the community of fx(hash) that showed so much support for the "Saturday" project, really beyond my expectations.

50% of the royalties goes to the minter, do with the piece whatever you'd like, hold it, sell or trade it, or even burn it if you really don't like it :)

Thank you!

----

Made with p5.js

metadata.name: Mythic Latent Glitches  #195
metadata.description:
What is even real and what is artificial?

In the contemporary light, the division between real and artificial loses weight as the concepts become more and more intertwined. In this work, the artist combines the human and generative inputs, in a counterintuitive manner, by allowing AI to design the organic elements and using the human hand to incorporate artificial glitches. What seemingly emerges as natural forms, was imagined solely by GAN, seeing the world through the limited examples through the photographer‚Äôs lenses. Artist‚Äôs role is also reversed, as their goal is to design the visual destruction process of the organic forms. Glitch is a malfunction of perception, it symbolizes the confusion caused by not being able to comprehend. 

The human fascination with metaphysical forces spans many centuries. While Pagan mythology created gods living in deep forests and under-explored territories, nowadays we approach technology with somewhat similar awe, fascination, and fear. 

The project has been developed in multiple stages. It started with an inspiration by the Lithuanian landscape and research of the ancient myths and legends. The photography aimed at capturing the mysterious, spanning months and years of different experiences. A custom pre-trained artist‚Äôs GAN model was then trained on a collection of several hundred photographs in high resolution. Selected outputs were curated by artist and included as a starting canvas for the next stage. Then, a set of stochastic manipulations were programmed to create alternative narratives through the visual destruction. Fog turns into smoke into burning radioactive forest in an unpredictable manner, guided by the random variables, their boundaries crafted by artist.  

Read more on the project website:
ivonatau.com/mythic-latent-glitches

- Use the "A" key to animate (if "Animated" feature is present).
- Press any key to stop the animation.
- Use the "S" key to export an image.

metadata.name: GRADIENT STUDY #91
metadata.description:
In which we define a simple goal: to transition between colors across a slice of space.

Then: summon the great teacher RANDOM to execute this vision.

And finally: take inspiration from the range of imagination that results.

---
- Made with p5js
- press s to save png

metadata.name: Solace #193
metadata.description:
Solace is an algorithm that generates artworks of sand dunes. It draws hundreds of thousands of tiny points according to a probability distribution calculated from the positions of the dunes.

The logic to divide the dunes into light and dark sides is simple, but produces some interesting chaotic behaviour. These are details that weren't hard-coded but emerge organically, such as the patterns on the spines of the dunes or the stripes around their bases.

Please note that the algorithm can take some time to run, especially when the number of dunes is high.

Created by lunarean.

metadata.name: symphony redux #294
metadata.description:
subject to interpretation, but inspired by JAM Whistler's Nocturne in Black and Gold

symphony was released on fx(hash) on December 21, 2021, with largely broken preview images. symphony redux is an update of the symphony code, with working previews and a few extra features.

controls:
s -- save as png
space bar -- pause/unpause
1-6 -- pixel density
